description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Milan's Heart" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Milan's Heart

places.generalDescription: Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II is a renowned 19th-century glass-covered arcade in Milan, Italy. It's situated at the heart of the city, connecting Piazza del Duomo and Piazza della Scala. The gallery is a major attraction for tourists due to its proximity to significant landmarks like the Cathedral (Duomo) and the opera theatre.

sources.snippet: It is the world‚Äôs oldest mall and one of the most beautiful regarding the architecture and the location. Galleria Vittorio Emanuelle II is located in the same square as Duomo, and both of them create amazing scenery in this fashionable city. High-end fashion boutiques, luxury brands, and modern cafes are some of the reasons to visit this place with your beloved one.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Milan

sources.snippet: For couples seeking a blend of luxury and romance, the Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II is the perfect choice. This historic arcade, with its intricate glass dome, exudes opulence and charm. A romantic dinner at one of the rooftop restaurants overlooking the cityscape adds an extra layer of elegance to the proposal.
sources.shortName: Romantic Spots for a Wedding Proposal in Milan

sources.snippet: The Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II has been dubbed il salotto di Milano, or ‚ÄúMilan‚Äôs living room‚Äù because it‚Äôs where all things exclusive come to become trendy ‚Äî whether in Italy or everywhere else across the world.
sources.shortName: Milan for Couples: 16 Fun and Romantic Things to Do

sources.snippet: From the Piazza del Duomo to Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II, there‚Äôs a mix of culture, art, and luxury waiting to be discovered.
sources.shortName: Travel Milan (and 4,000+ other cities) like a local

places.name: Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II

reviews.text:
Walking into the Galleria felt like entering a dream carved in glass and light. The high dome above, the mosaic beneath my feet everything shimmered with a quiet kind of grandeur. It wasn't just a shopping arcade; it was a sacred space dressed as elegance.

There was history in the air not dusty, but alive. As if the walls had witnessed centuries of desire, beauty, longing, and grace. I didn't feel like a tourist. I felt like I had entered a story I somehow already knew.

I stood beneath the glass ceiling, watching sunlight pour in like divine gold, and felt the same sense of reverence I'd feel in a cathedral. There was luxury, yes but also soul. A reminder that beauty, when done with intention, becomes timeless.

Galleria Vittorio didn't ask me to buy anything. It asked me to remember who I am: a woman who belongs in places made of light, art, and legacy.

There are some delicious restaurants inside, but from what I've observed, they can be a bit pricey; there are certainly more affordable options. It's a great place for taking photos. The architecture is stunning. It's incredibly impressive. You can also find most of the luxury brands inside.It's a must-see after the Duomo Cathedral. The women and men here are always so stylish and well-groomed, I was impressed. :)

Attractive covered shopping arcade next to the cathedral. Lots of high end shopping options, as well as both reasonable and expensive eating options. Impressive architecture all around. Well worth strolling through and stopping for food or at least gelato. Easily combined with the cathedral next door as well as the cathedral museum.

places.generalDescription: The Duomo di Milano, also known as the Milan Cathedral, is a stunning example of Gothic architecture that took over 600 years to complete. Adorned with Candoglia marble, its facade boasts 135 spires and 3,400 statues. Inside, visitors can admire the impressive stained glass depicting biblical scenes and marvel at the enormous harmonica statue and golden Madonnina statue.

sources.snippet: The Milan Cathedral, or Duomo di Milano, stands as an iconic symbol of the city. Ascending to its rooftop unveils panoramic views of Milan that are truly breathtaking. You can time your visit to coincide with sunset on days where it closes at a later time, creating a proposal moment against the backdrop of the cathedral‚Äôs Gothic spires.
sources.shortName: Romantic Spots for a Wedding Proposal in Milan

places.name: Duomo di Milano

reviews.text:
Stepping up to the Duomo di Milano was an incredible experience, and it holds a special place in my heart because it was the very first place I ever visited as a solo traveller.

You see pictures of it, but they really don't do it justice. The sheer scale and intricate detail of the Gothic architecture are absolutely breathtaking. I remember just standing in the piazza for a good long while, just taking it all in-the spires, the statues, every little carving. It was an awe-inspiring moment that made me feel so small and, at the same time, so empowered to be out there on my own.

The best part, without a doubt, was climbing to the rooftop terraces. The views are out of this world! You get to walk right among the spires and statues, with a 360-degree panorama of Milan. I went just as the sun was starting to set, and watching the city turn to gold from up there was something I'll never forget. It was the perfect ending to my first day of solo travel, a moment of pure freedom and beauty.

Even the inside is stunning, with all the stained-glass windows and massive columns. But for me, it was that moment on the roof, surrounded by that incredible craftsmanship, that made it a truly unforgettable experience.

The Duomo in Milan is a must-see, right in the heart of the city. We purchased our tickets in advance, which made the visit smoother. I highly recommend going up to the rooftop, while an elevator is available, climbing the stairs makes the experience more special. From the top, you get amazing views of the city and great photo opportunities. It's also less crowded if you visit in the morning.

Visiting the Duomo di Milano was one of the most memorable experiences of my trip to Italy. Even before you step inside, the exterior takes your breath away. The sheer scale of the cathedral, combined with the intricate Gothic architecture and countless statues and spires, is simply awe-inspiring. It's the kind of place that makes you stop in your tracks.

Inside, the atmosphere is just as powerful. The stained-glass windows are absolutely stunning, casting colorful light across the vast interior. The detail in every column, sculpture, and altar shows the centuries of craftsmanship and devotion that went into building this masterpiece. It's both peaceful and overwhelming at the same time.

One of the highlights for me was taking the stairs up to the rooftop. It's a bit of a climb, but totally worth it. Walking among the spires and seeing the city from above ‚Äì with the Alps in the distance on a clear day ‚Äì is an experience I won't forget.

Whether you're religious or not, the Duomo is a place that speaks to you. It's more than just a tourist attraction ‚Äì it's a symbol of Milan, history, and human creativity.

Don't miss it if you're in the city. Truly unforgettable.

places.address: P.za del Duomo, 20122 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Teatro alla Scala, also known as La Scala, is an opulent 18th-century theater renowned for its Italian opera and ballet performances. The theater features a museum showcasing its rich history through exhibitions of costumes, musical instruments, photographs, and set designs. Additionally, the Livia Simoni Library houses an extensive collection of 150,000 volumes of librettos, scores, and periodicals.

sources.snippet: Sumptuous red velvet, opulent soaring ceilings, and tiers of gilded stucco dating back to the eighteenth century‚Äîit‚Äôs a scene set for romance at stunning Teatro alla Scala. Seeing a performance in this legendary neoclassical hall where the world's greatest composers, operas, and ballets have premiered is an unrivaled experience. Insider Tip: Don‚Äôt miss the epic love story Onegin, the classical ballet with music by Tchaikovsky that‚Äôs art come to life from gorgeous sets to stunning costumes and dancers that defy gravity.
sources.shortName: How To Spend The Ultimate Romantic Weekend In Milan

sources.snippet: At the Teatro alla Scala, one of the greatest opera houses in Italy and, indeed, in the world, you can act out the famous scene from ‚ÄòPretty Woman‚Äô, in which Richard Gere and Julia Roberts enjoy a romantic evening at the opera. The Teatro alla Scala dates from the eighteenth century, and its lavish d√©cor will leave you open-mouthed with wonder. Submit to its charms as you fall in love while enjoying one of the classic works performed on its stage.
sources.shortName: Ideas for enjoying Milan as a couple

places.name: Teatro alla Scala

reviews.text: The museum has many performing art relevant collections.  The theater offers beautiful forms of architecture.  I definitely will schedule to see show here next time I'm in Milan.

Went on self guided tour. It featured several rooms with portraits of composers and performers through history and a lovely exhibit on ballet. It was very short, and it did not focus as much on the music as the art of movement, but it is worth seeing the theater.

A must-visit when in Milan, but plan ahead. We went during the August shut-down, so there wasn't much to see apart from the tour. Still, the tour was interesting and included a visit to the theatre boxes, plus entry to the attached museum. Definitely book tours in advance, and if you can, time your visit outside of August so you get the full experience of seeing an opera.

places.generalDescription: Located in a stunning palazzo that once served as a Jesuit college and observatory, the Pinacoteca di Brera is a must-visit for art enthusiasts. This museum boasts an impressive collection of Italian paintings, with works by renowned artists such as Raphael, Tintoretto, and Mantegna. The palazzo's rich history adds to the allure of this cultural gem in Milan.

sources.snippet: At Pinacoteca di Brera, you can ogle over 500 ancient masterpieces to your heart‚Äôs content‚Äîthe mind-blowing collection includes works from Tintoretto and Caravaggio to Rembrandt, Mantegna, Bellini, and beyond. But the standout: Il Bacio, by Francesco Hayez, depicting a couple from the Middle Ages engaged in a passionate kiss.
sources.shortName: How To Spend The Ultimate Romantic Weekend In Milan
Things to do in Milan for couples

places.name: Pinacoteca di Brera

reviews.text: The museum is absolutely gorgeous. There are many historical paintings from famous authors inside. Although I am not really interested in art I definitely would recommend including it in your Milan's trip itinerary

The museum is well ventilated with AC. There are lots of paintings of Jesus Christ and Mary. Took me about 1.5-2 hours to see everything. What I liked the most were the sculptures and statues. Perfect place to go if you love early Renaissance art. The staff speaks English which is good and for each painting, there is a description in English. The price is 15‚Ç¨ which is a bit much.

Beautiful art gallery that contains several works and most of them by Italian artists. Some of these are famous for more while others only for those who have a particular interest. The rooms should be better organised but 90 minutes will pass quickly also thanks to the audio guide. Fortunately I didn't have to book but I noticed that after 12 pm, the turnout was greatly increased.

places.generalDescription: Al Garghet is a charming rustic restaurant located just 20 minutes from Milan in via Selvanesco. Since 1991, it has been known for serving traditional Lombardy-region pasta and rice dishes, including the famous elephant ear - a special bread-fried veal cutlet. The restaurant offers a peaceful garden terrace where guests can dine al fresco in the summer. The interior features different decor styles, from a Scottish cottage to a verdant outdoor garden.

sources.snippet: Located 20 minutes from Milan in via Selvanesco, Al Garghet has been since 1991 one of the most magical and romantic places to eat the famous ‚Äúelephant ear‚Äù (a special bread-fried veal cutlet) prepared just like it once was. The host of this magical kingdom, Emanuela Cipolla, has created a ‚ÄúMiddle-Earth‚Äù inspired by the charm of the countryside, from the English one made of tartans and fantastic creatures, to the railing houses of the Milanese suburbs. ‚ÄúGarghet‚Äù in Milanese is, in fact, the croaking of frogs that still entertain guests in the wonderful flower garden where, in summer, you can eat al fresco on the veranda or under the country chic umbrellas.
sources.shortName: The most romantic restaurants in Milan

sources.snippet: For couples looking for a top dining experience, Giacomo Arengario offers an exclusive view of Piazza Duomo, while the ambiance of Al Garghet captures the charm of the Italian countryside.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants in Milan: Top Picks

places.name: Al Garghet

reviews.text: We went there with my husband for a birthday dinner and it was such an experience! I am a bugger fun of gnocchi, I ate the ones with pumpkin, and it was an absolute masterpiece! I also loved the sweet sparkling red wine, which is my new discovery! When we informed the stuff about our celebration, we got the cake with the candle, which was a very nice touch :) Also the atmosphere is very private and cosy, even though the place is big. Just remember that you need to make a reservation before going there.

Absolutely adorable restaurant which I would love to visit again if I go to Milan. It has the nice rustic romantic and cozy vibes and with so many cute details. The food was good too, recommend the eggplant dish! üòã

Absolutely loved our dining experience here! The service was exceptional from start to finish - the staff were warm, professional, and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. The food was equally impressive: delicious, full of flavor, and served in very generous portions. Every dish was beautifully presented and tasted as good as it looked. It's rare to find a place that combines outstanding hospitality with such high-quality cuisine. Highly recommend and can't wait to return!

places.generalDescription: Parco Sempione is a must-visit location in Milan, known for its beautiful landscaping by Emilio Alemagna. This park offers a perfect blend of outdoor activities such as walking trails, running paths, and dog-friendly areas. It also features historic architecture like the triumphal Arco della Pace and the romantic Ponte delle Sirenette with statues of little mermaids.

sources.snippet: Look for the "Bridge of the Mermaids" within Parco Sempione: here, far from the gaze of passersby and tourists, you can enjoy some intimacy. Legend has it that all lovers who exchange a kiss here will forever avoid betrayal. A kiss on the stone bridge crossing the small lake will surely be a charming experience in Milan!
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Milan

sources.snippet: For another unique proposal experience with a panoramic view, you can venture to Monte Stella, a man-made hill in Parco Sempione. Climbing to the summit rewards them with panoramic views of Milan. A proposal against the city‚Äôs twinkling lights or under the starry night sky is extraordinary and unforgettable.
sources.shortName: Romantic Spots for a Wedding Proposal in Milan

sources.snippet: Right behind the Sforza Castle, you‚Äôll find the largest park in central Milan: Parco Sempione. Beautifully landscaped, the park is home to a design and art museum (Triennale di Milano), an observation tower (Branca Tower), as well as an aquarium.
sources.shortName: Milan for Couples: 16 Fun and Romantic Things to Do

places.name: Parco Sempione

reviews.text:
Parco Sempione is hands down one of my favorite parks-maybe anywhere. It's massive, but somehow still feels peaceful. There are cafes and restaurants tucked inside, wide open lawns that are actually clean and perfect for picnics, and tons of dog parks. One even has an agility course.

The views here are unreal-on one end you've got the towering Arco della Pace, and on the other, the stunning Castello Sforzesco. One of the hidden gems is the Mermaid Bridge-an old stone bridge with beautiful carvings of mermaids, built in the 1800s.

The park also has beautiful ponds and little streams, full of fish, ducks, and even turtles. It's amazing for birdwatching-tons of species, and if you look carefully, you might even spot the bright green parrots.

There's also a cool children's amusement park, basketball court, sports arena, outdoor workout stations, and tons of fountains in case you or your pup get thirsty. You'll almost always catch someone playing live music, which just adds to the magic of the park. And if you're into culture, the Triennale design museum and the Civic Aquarium are both right here too.

It truly has everything and should not be missed.

As you stroll through, you eventually reach the other side where the Arch of Triumph awaits. It's quite a walk, so make sure to bring water especially on hot days!

The park is spotlessly clean, with beautiful green spaces, ponds with ducks, a small bridge, and even outdoor gym equipment. It's an absolutely lovely place for a refreshing and enjoyable walk.

Highly recommended for a peaceful getaway in nature üå≥üåøüå±
After visiting the gardens & the palace at Versailles these hold no match. But since one is in Milan good for a walk. The best thing was live music being played here & one can sit & watch.

places.generalDescription: Ribot Restaurant is a family-run establishment that has been serving up grilled meats and Tuscan cuisine since 1975. The restaurant is known for its specialty in Florentine steaks, ribs, and fillets from both national and foreign sources. Conveniently located near the motorway with ample parking, Ribot is easily accessible by car or metro. The restaurant pays homage to horse racing, taking its name from the renowned racehorse Ribot.

sources.snippet: A nineteenth-century house at No. 41 Via Marco Cremosano is home to the Ribot restaurant. Along with this establishment‚Äôs romantic atmosphere, you can enjoy its chargrilled meat dishes and its Tuscan cooking.
sources.shortName: Ideas for enjoying Milan as a couple

places.name: Ribot Restaurant

reviews.text:
The best steak and risotto I've had ever!
I visited this restaurant on Milano trip from Japan, it was amazing experience.
All foods are delicious and staffs are so gentle. I was late to arrive the restaurant because strike occurred, but they kept our seat.

I'll definitely visit this restaurant if I visit Milano again.

Fully booked so I had 45min from start til end. All else considered, book in advanced. Ribeye was decent. Happy customer.
Surprised me with an apple cake/pie.
A place to return to

Nice staff. Excellent foods, especially appetizers of melon with pork. Also, good experience Tbone steak. But there are lots of bugs such as flies and mosquitos. It is a typical Italian social restaurant. Should pay attention to the dress code.

places.address: Via Marco Cremosano, 41, 20148 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Nestled in Milan, Premiata Trattoria Arlati dal 1936 is a charming family-run trattoria that has been serving up traditional Milanese fare since its establishment. This historic restaurant holds the oldest family license in the city and is renowned for its rich culinary heritage and vibrant atmosphere.

sources.snippet: Among the most historic restaurants in Milan, since 1936 it has been the oldest family license in the city, Trattoria Arlati is a bulwark of the Milanese food and wine tradition, the art of cabaret and live music. Welcomed by the symbol of the restaurant, a 2-meter high ostrich made with playing cards by the Turin artist Nicola Bolla, and by its host Leopoldo Arlati, the restaurant is unique in Italy for its layered decor. It combines, in fact, the warmth of the trattorias of the past with the charm of the Parisian ateliers of the turn of the century among noir walls, original works of art and the many photos hanging on the walls.
sources.shortName: The most romantic restaurants in Milan

places.name: Premiata Trattoria Arlati dal 1936

reviews.text:
If you're seeking an authentic Milanese dining experience, Trattoria Arlati is a true hidden gem that perfectly blends tradition and charm. Tucked away from the tourist hotspots, this cozy establishment feels like a well-kept secret among those who truly appreciate Milan's culinary heritage. The menu is filled with time-honored regional dishes, prepared with love and a deep respect for tradition, from risotto alla Milanese to osso buco that melts in your mouth.

What sets this place apart is its selection of exquisite wines, carefully curated to complement the flavors of each dish. The sommelier's recommendations are spot on, featuring both local Lombardian labels and a few surprising, lesser-known treasures from Italy's best vineyards. The ambiance is intimate yet unpretentious, making it the perfect spot for food connoisseurs who enjoy discovering Milan's gastronomic heart away from the crowds. For a dining experience that's both authentic and refined, Trattoria Arlati is a must-visit.
Fantastic cuisine and atmosphere! I visited there at lunch time in sunny April day and had Milanese risotto. You'll regret the opportunity if you don't visit.
A bit far away from the the centre of Milan but worth to visit this stylish family owned restaurant. Classic, great milanese flavours, exceptional service and atmosphere!

places.address: Via Alberto Nota, 47, 20126 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Villa Necchi Campiglio is a stunning museum in Milan, featuring an architect-designed villa adorned with decorative arts, paintings, and period furniture. Located in the Porta Venezia district, it offers a serene escape amidst historical and artistic wonders. The area boasts Liberty villas and vibrant flora, making it a paradise for history and art enthusiasts. Nearby Corso Venezia presents an opportunity for high-fashion shopping with renowned brands lining the street.

sources.snippet: The city has two antique mansions: the Villa Necchi and the Villa Invernizzi. The former has a gorgeous dehor, a perfect setting for a snack or lunch. At the latter, you can see the flamingos.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Milan for couples

places.name: Villa Necchi Campiglio

reviews.text:
It was a fascinating experience. I find it incredible how museums and memorial houses have remained in the same form and composition as when they were inhabited by their owners. This is also the case here. The fact that you can see so many authentic details, walk freely through the house among the furniture, imagine the lives of those who lived here, and better understand the historical and cultural context is truly special. Not to mention the architectural execution.

Additionally, the quality of the audio guide was excellent, providing a wealth of information accompanied by a soundtrack that immerses you in the story. It is definitely a great starting point for getting to know the city of Milan.

A must see villa from the 1930s and it's garden. The villa belonged to 2 sisters who enabled the public to visit it. It is totally furnished and there are qualitative explanations via QR code + cultural mediators on site. Garden is free and there is a nice coffee by the pool.

Villa Necchi Campiglio is a true hidden treasure in Milan, offering a glimpse into a world of timeless elegance and understated luxury. Nestled in a lush, peaceful garden, this architectural masterpiece is a stunning example of 1930s modernism, yet it feels incredibly warm and personal.

Every detail in the villa tells a story, from the refined furniture and exquisite art collection to the cutting-edge innovations for its time, like the first private heated swimming pool in Milan. Walking through the rooms, you can almost hear the whispers of glamorous parties and the footsteps of the Necchi family, who lived here. It's more than a museum-it's a journey back in time to an era of sophistication and taste.

What sets Villa Necchi apart is its ability to balance grandeur with intimacy. The tour guides bring the space to life with fascinating anecdotes about the family and the era, making the experience both educational and enchanting.

If you want to immerse yourself in Milan's rich cultural heritage and take a break from the city's fast pace, Villa Necchi is an absolute must-visit. It's a place that lingers in your mind long after you leave-a true gem that deserves to be celebrated.

places.generalDescription: Bosco Verticale Restaurant is a modern Italian restaurant located in the heart of Milan. The food is excellent, and the staff are friendly and welcoming. It's great for leisurely meals with friends or family, or if you're looking for a good night out.

sources.snippet: Take for example Bosco Verticale Restaurant Milano, where diners can enjoy a candlelit meal amidst the innovative vertical forest architecture. This hidden gem provides a unique escape where lovers can revel in tranquility.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants in Milan: Top Picks

places.name: Bosco Verticale Restaurant

reviews.text: My tour guider recommended this restaurant then we come. It's sooooooo good. Amazing environment, even had live piano as background. Food is soooooooo delicious, staffs are so sweet. Can't say anything bad about this restaurant. And price is not expensive, definitely worth to have a dinner here

Elegant, cozy, lovely restaurant. There is free apetizer with 3 types of breads (hazelnut/cocoa/normal), which are the restaurant's specialty. Combined with olive oil is a must have!

I ordered crispy octopus with lemon creamed potatoes. Perfect taste combination!

My partner ordered grilled lamp chops with new potatoes. Also recommend!

For our desserts (tiramisu with Bronte pistachios and cocoa beans; New York cheesecake with red fruits) we got free liqueurs per person just a gift of the restaurant. Kindly gesture, went well to both of them.

Highly  recommend this restaurant Greetings from Hungary.

I decided to try a bougie Italian restaurant, and it turned out to be a mistake. The squids were not properly cleaned and had bones. Pretty disgusting and very unexpected for the price of dish. Never coming back.

Correction 1.
Squids do not have bone but have a hard shell inside of them, which function as bones in other groups of animals. It's a very thin and hard plate, keeps them in the shape, and protects them. So yes, squids have a body structure similar to bone. And it's one of the parts you have to take off when you clean squids for cooking.

Correction 2.
I chewed on it (it was so disgusting), immediately spat it out, and notified one of the servers. They did not offer me anything but to re-make the dish. I had finished 1 of 2 Squids at the time and the sever came back with 1 SQUID. I WAS NOT OFFERED ANYTHING EXTRA.

This is just one bad review out of hundreds of good ones. I post all cons/pros in my reviews to give a head up of what can possibly happen at the place. There is no reason to be so offended to respond with FALSE INFORMATION especially when it's the business' fault.

places.address: Via Federico Confalonieri, Via Volturno, 15, 20124 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Ceresio 7 Pools & Restaurant is a rooftop dining and leisure destination located atop the Dsquared2 headquarters in Milan. The venue features an iconic terrace with swimming pools, offering a stunning 360-degree view of the city's skyline. The restaurant, led by chef Elio Sironi, serves modern Italian cuisine made from fresh ingredients and contemporary influences. With its rich wine selection and well-crafted cocktails at the bar, Ceresio 7 provides a sophisticated dining experience.

sources.snippet: Ceresio 7 Pools & Restaurant in Milan offers a bright, welcoming atmosphere set around two pools and a chic dining space. It‚Äôs known for its relaxed but lively vibe, where you can enjoy a drink or a meal in a stylish setting without feeling too formal.
sources.shortName: The 15 Best Romantic Restaurants in Milan

places.name: Ceresio 7 Pools & Restaurant

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of experiencing the tasting menu with a carefully curated wine pairing for each course, and it was truly a feast for the senses. Each dish was beautifully composed, full of flavor, and presented with incredible attention to detail. The wines paired perfectly, enhancing the essence of every bite and creating a wonderfully harmonious experience. The service was exceptional ‚Äì professional, warm, and genuinely passionate about both the food and wine. It felt like a perfectly guided culinary journey from start to finish. Highly recommended for anyone who appreciates fine dining and thoughtful hospitality!

I was really looking forward to visiting Ceresio 7, but the experience was beyond disappointing. My friends and I arrived at the rooftop and were told to wait 10 minutes because they were still setting up. We were patient, but 10 minutes turned into nearly 40 without any updates or acknowledgment. For a venue that markets itself as high-end, this level of disorganization is unacceptable.
However, what truly shocked me was the attitude of the receptionist, Sara. Hospitality is the foundation of any premium establishment, and the complete lack of professionalism I experienced was beyond unacceptable. I won't go into details, but I sincerely hope management is aware of how their employee is treating guests-because if this is the standard, it reflects very poorly on the people running this place.
To make matters worse, once inside, I started noticing things I normally wouldn't if the service had been good-cheap cutlery, damaged walls, worn-out furniture. For a place that positions itself as high-end, it certainly didn't feel that way.
I don't usually leave reviews, but this experience was so disappointing that I felt obligated to say something. Hopefully, the right people see this and take the necessary action, because word gets around quickly in certain circles.

We went to enjoy aperarivo time and found the drinks to be steeply priced, but fantastic. On top of this the sampler of food delivered was exceptional! The tartar was mind blowing.

I really enjoyed the afternoon here with good views, drinks, bites, and kind staff who were attentive and caring well for us.

places.generalDescription: Sine is a great restaurant with amazing food, kind service and nice ambience. The dishes are simple but tasty, with all the courses on the menu! I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an excellent meal in Milan.

sources.snippet: As Milan forges ahead, innovative venues like Levino Milano and Sine by Di Pinto break culinary boundaries, harmonizing Italian roots with global influences. Anyma Gastronomia Bistrot offers a modern take on Italian classics, infusing them with bold international techniques, while Mam√≠e and Pinkeri add a contemporary twist to cherished Italian recipes.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants in Milan: Top Picks

places.name: Sine by Di Pinto

reviews.text:
This restaurant is really something that real foodies will appreciate as it is cuisine with a soul!!! The head chef and founder of the restaurant was present and seems to be very involved in the restaurant workings. Most of the menu is built around his passions and life experiences and as such not only will it give you this notion of intimacy with it's creator but it is also something that clearly was done with passion and the plates were delicious and tasty in that way that home cooking is often tastier than nouvelle cuisine.
But make no mistake, no letting the authenticity of the approach fool you, this was a Michelin caliber type experience!
An added benefit that their particular relationships with specific wineries that made for some nice discoveries on that side of the experience.
Finally the restaurant is not very large and the kitchen is easily visible (see through wall) from most tables and as such the relationship with the staff is very close as well, they are always right there at your disposal when you need them and since they are always close by they do not feel the need to "check on you" regularly and interrupt your conversations, they are just there as soon as you need them... thorough enjoyment

They just got their Michelin star and they fully deserve it. Creative without being a pretentious or overdone. Surprising, yet real food and not just a show. Amazingly friendly staff, they make you feel fully taken care of. Funky atmosphere. Very good wine selection with a good price quality ratio. It was my second visit and it is now in my list of favourites.

Such a  magical experience we had. The food, quality, the menu, the variety !!! We enjoyed every minute of it. The chef himself attended every table and explained every detail of the dishes .. brilliant

places.generalDescription: When visiting Milan, one of the must-see attractions is the Duomo di Milano, a stunning gothic cathedral that has taken several centuries to complete. The cathedral's pink marble facade adorned with numerous statues, spires, and gargoyles makes it a truly spectacular sight. It is considered by many as the main reason to visit Milan. In addition to its iconic beauty, there is much more to explore in Milan beyond the famous cathedral.

sources.snippet: Milan is one of the most known fashion cities in the world, but except its luxury and good taste this city has some of the most romantic spots. The first thing to see when in Milan is the Duomo and its magnificent square, but one of the most romantic things to do is to go during the afternoon. It is quite fascinating to climb to the rooftops where you can enjoy the extraordinary scenery and view of the city.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Milan

sources.snippet: Discover with us the best spots and must-see locations for a romantic day or weekend in Milan: from a stroll along the Navigli to the Castello Sforzesco, from the view of the Duomo to an aperitif on the chicest rooftop in the city.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Milan

places.name: Duomo

reviews.text: The Duomo is absolutely stunning and a must-see! The atmosphere around it is vibrant and full of life, even late at night. We visited at 10 PM, and the area was still buzzing with energy, with people enjoying the sights and the lively surroundings.

You can get off the metro right at Duomo Square, and the view as you step outside is absolutely stunning. The station itself is a bit old, but it's very convenient with solid connections to other metro lines and buses.

A beautiful gothic cathedral. Amazing attention to detail both inside and out. The trip to the roof was fantastic. The museum and ruins under the cathedral were interesting too. Well worth the combined ticket price. Just scan a QR code whilst queuing to purchase. Very straightforward.

places.address: P.za del Duomo, 20122 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Nottingham Forest Cocktail Bar is a cozy and rustic space that has gained a reputation as one of the best experimental cocktail bars globally. The dimly lit bar is filled with an assortment of curios and memorabilia, creating an intimate and snug atmosphere perfect for a date night. The bar offers expertly prepared molecular concoctions with innovative flavor combinations, served in quirky receptacles like first aid kits and miniature bathtubs.

sources.snippet: The Nottingham Forest is a cocktail bar in Milan where you can enjoy the after dinner with your partner. After your drink, you are ready for your last activity of the day.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Milan for couples

places.name: Nottingham Forest

reviews.text:
This bar is an absolute gem! The cocktails were nothing short of amazing--each one expertly crafted with a unique twist that elevated the experience. Every drink felt intentional, creative, and perfectly balanced.

Tony behind the bar is a true standout, bringing both incredible skill and a welcoming energy that made the night even better. The atmosphere? Plush, stylish, and effortlessly cool--the kind of place where you want to settle in and savor every moment.

From the drinks to the service to the ambiance, everything was top-notch. Easily one of the best bars I've been to, and I can't wait to return!
Athmosphere was perfect. We had 4 cocktails and they were all delicious and fun. Staff was very friendly. Service was very fast. Definitely a must see place in Milano!

We visited Nottingham Forest out of curiosity after hearing so much about their experimental cocktails and theatrical presentation. The place definitely lives up to its reputation for creativity-every drink felt like part of a show, with dramatic glassware, smoke effects, and unique ingredients that make the experience quite memorable.

That said, while the presentation was impressive, the actual taste of the cocktails didn't quite live up to the hype for me. It felt like the focus was more on the spectacle than the flavor. Still, I can see how it would be a fun spot for people who enjoy adventurous, Instagram-worthy drinks.

Worth a visit if you're into mixology as entertainment, but not the place I'd go for a classic, great-tasting cocktail.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in Milan's Brera district, the Brera Botanical Garden is a serene and picturesque oasis established in 1774. This hidden gem boasts flowerbeds, ponds, and an arboretum with centuries-old trees. The garden offers a peaceful setting for photography, with diverse plant collections providing a colorful backdrop. It's an ideal spot for intimate moments or a leisurely stroll amidst rare beauty and timeless atmosphere.

sources.snippet: Tucked away in Milan‚Äôs artsy Brera district is the Brera Botanical Garden, a secluded oasis amidst the urban bustle. Exotic plants, fragrant blooms, and tranquil ponds create an intimate atmosphere for couples to cherish. A proposal here offers privacy and serenity, making it an ideal spot for an intimate moment.
sources.shortName: Romantic Spots for a Wedding Proposal in Milan

places.name: Brera Botanical Garden

reviews.text:
What a charming and lovely garden!
It's between the Pinacoteca di Brera and Palazzo Citterio.  Finding a main entrance was a little tricky. It's not a big garden but enough size to look around and enjoy. You can relax here if you want to have a quiet time from a bustling crowd in Milan.
I expected more, it's a small place and the majority of plants are the basic ones that you can find everywhere. Also not a super quiet place to relax but still worth seeing.

A really small and basic garden, with plants you can find almost everywhere. Good for a 5 minute stroll however there is nothing to come back for. The flowers on the photo are the most interesting part of my visit :)

places.generalDescription: Contraste is a unique dining experience that offers an unexpected and innovative approach to contemporary cuisine. The restaurant's stark white dining room sets the stage for a whimsical and immersive culinary journey. From the warm welcome to the much-anticipated tasting, Contraste aims to defy traditional notions of innovation by experimenting with textures, shapes, and flavors in their stunning dishes.

sources.snippet: Contraste‚Äôs approach to cuisine is a profound exploration of this concept, where the traditional framework of a menu is replaced with a more personalized encounter. Potafiori adds another layer to this experience, intertwining the concept of a concept store with an eatery, all ushered by the delightful Rosalba Piccinni, the singing florist who serenades diners amidst the blooms.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants in Milan: Top Picks

sources.snippet: Contraste in Milan takes a thoughtful approach to tasting menus that many find refreshing. The chef and team explore new ideas, aiming to share flavors and presentations diners might not have experienced before. It‚Äôs a welcoming spot that can rekindle anyone‚Äôs enjoyment of a carefully curated meal.
sources.shortName: The 15 Best Romantic Restaurants in Milan

places.name: Contraste

reviews.text:
Over the top, fun, weird, gimmicky, colourful, whimsical: I loved it. Fine dining doesn't need to be boring and Contraste definitely isn't boring!

A surprise tasting menu was served with highlights including mussels calcio e pepe, rabbit kidneys and a chocolate dessert. The pinnacle was the genius bolognese donut.

Wine pairing was interesting and well-balanced - there were several options of how many glasses of wine to include in the pairing, which is a great idea. Service was perfect and the dining room is decorated in a very cool way

The service was incredible and the ambience was modern, chic and clean.

The food however didn't live up to the expectations and the taste felt a bit lackluster. Apart from the first dish, none of them had a back story or context of inspiration. We took the initiative to inquire about the chefs to find out more.

Loved the desert and the rose cake at the end.

This restaurant boasts creative and entertaining ideas transformed into dishes. The impressive theme featured various hand-expressed emotions. Not only did the food tantalize my taste buds, but I also enjoyed speculating about how each dish was crafted. To create each form, the chef utilized diverse ingredients and colors. Overall, the incorporation of cheese added a rich and creamy flavor, while the textures alternated between firm and soft in each course. The noodle-based dish mimicked the chewiness of clams, and the broths were savory. Encasing mussels in a soft cheese and finishing with pepper foam made the dish enjoyable even for those unaccustomed to spicy food. Each dish's plating complemented the plate's design, and the dessert's presentation evoked excitement, much like opening a secret box. The final bread and ice cream were a fitting conclusion, particularly the exceptional ice cream. The staff were courteous and enthusiastic when explaining the appetizers. However, I questioned the professionalism when the first staff member placed the amuse-bouche, only for other staff to reposition it. Unlike other Michelin-starred restaurants, this establishment did not offer adjusted menus or portions for children, which was disappointing. The restaurant's interior exuded a modern, simple ambiance, and entering through the gate and passing a small garden felt like entering a home.

places.address: Via Giuseppe Meda, 2, 20136 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Villa Reale is a neoclassical palace and museum for modern art located in Milan. It is surrounded by English gardens, making it a picturesque destination for visitors. The adjacent Giardino di Villa Reale offers an elegant park with green spaces, leafy pathways, small ponds, and charming bridges, perfect for a romantic stroll or a family outing. The park's enchanting garden adds to the allure of the area.

sources.snippet: What is more romantic than walking in a scenic park during fall?. Milan has some of the most extraordinary parks with beautiful sceneries, which are definitely for a romantic walk. Giardino di Villa Reale is an elegant park with plenty of green spaces, leafy pathways, small ponds, and cute bridges to enjoy with your loved one.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Milan

sources.snippet: One of the fun things to do for couples in Milan is visiting the Villa Reale. Here, you can enjoy a break at the L√πBar, which is both an art gallery and a bistro.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Milan for couples
Milan for Couples: 16 Fun and Romantic Things to Do

places.name: Villa Reale

reviews.text:
Villa Reale, also known as Villa Belgiojoso Bonaparte, is a prime example of neoclassical architecture in Milan.
Today, Villa Reale houses the Galleria d'Arte Moderna with an extensive collection of 19th-century artworks, featuring masterpieces by artists such as Canova, C√©zanne, Van Gogh, Gauguin, and Manet.
The villa is surrounded by beautifully landscaped gardens, with various sculptures

Beautiful palace and nice paintings collection. Several paintings are by world renowned artists.
However the staff is a bit paranoid and approach you to tell you off for literally everything - we are a family of quiet and calm adults so this was really strange and unnecessary, and never happened to us before anywhere else (and we saw this happening to the other visitors too).
Also at the moment of our visit the entire  second floor was closed to public (half of the collection) , this was not visibly mentioned anywhere on the site so we were quite disappointed , as all the famous artists' paintings are exactly on that floor. That part of the museum will stay closed for a while, possibly for over a year, as staff suggested.
I love this place in the morning . You can enter from the main gate and go direct behind the building and enjoy the garden with the birds sounds and water fall . And the ducks dancing around üòÄ

places.generalDescription: Quadrilatero d'Oro, also known as the Golden Rectangle, is a renowned luxury shopping district in Milan. It is home to flagship stores of Italy's most famous designers such as Giorgio Armani, Gucci, and Versace. The area centers around Via Monte Napoleone, Via Spiga, Via Sant'Andrea, and Via Borgospesso.

sources.shortName: Things to do in Milan for couples

places.name: Quadrilatero d'Oro

reviews.text: Luxury brand shopping amd abundant amt of caf√©s restaurants and gelato . All brand u r looking for under one roof. This is am outdoor village style shopping most branda have more than one shop. U can easily spend full day here.

Well worth a walk around.
Ridiculous prices, but worth window shopping. ü§£ü§£

It's a road full of designer clothes ü§∑üèª
The lights are much better than London

places.address: Via Monte Napoleone, 10, 20121 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Ristorante Berton is a modern and elegant dining establishment located in the Porta Nuova Varesine district amidst the futuristic skyscrapers of New Milan. Renowned chef Andrea Berton's culinary expertise shines through in the meticulously prepared pasta, meat, and fish dishes as well as refined tasting menus. The restaurant's minimalist setting perfectly complements its clear and balanced cuisine, which emphasizes the purest expression of each ingredient without unnecessary embellishments.

sources.snippet: Set in Milan‚Äôs futuristic Porta Nuova district, Ristorante Berton features a sleek, glass-walled dining room that reflects its minimalistic style. Chef Andrea Berton‚Äôs modern and straightforward approach focuses on a select few ingredients, creating refined dishes without needless fuss. This balance of simplicity and creativity helped the restaurant earn Michelin recognition shortly after opening.
sources.shortName: The 15 Best Romantic Restaurants in Milan

places.name: Ristorante Berton

reviews.text: Definitely great place to eat with outstanding service. We had a signature menu (which consists of their very best dishes as I understand) and also business lunch, everything was very good, but not everything was WOW. Risotto from business lunch was much better than pizzaiola risotto from signature menu, roasted eel has deeply dissapointed me (I'm a big fan of unagi). Desserts from signature menu were not good enough while chocolate cake with mint sorbe was very surprising. In general we enjoyed our meals very much, bust expected a little bit more from this highly rated place.

Magnificent experience and flavours. Extraordinary interior and design. Service was extremely fast and helpful. Food of extremely high quality and mouthgasm indulgent. Selected a pre made menu for ‚Ç¨160 and got a lot more plates in-between than menu stated - free of charge! Menu states 7 courses but we received 10 rounds overall of appetizers and food. Me and my partner are so full and we eat big portions at home. Highly recommend.
We also received chocolate hazelnuts in a little bag on departure which I thought was charming.

I came here on my last evening before flying out from Milan the next day! I went to Milan for a week, and this is a really special find for a perfect evening.

I arrived on time and immediately sat down at my table by a very friendly hostess, the table was cosy and intimate with a good view of the restaurant. I was on my own, but I knew I wasn't going to feel on my own.

I went for the tasting menu, and I paired it with a really nice white wine. My waiter was really attentive and really looked after me and was very friendly.

The food was excellent, the service exceptional. Come here if you want a really good, solid restaurant with an amazing atmosphere and friendly staff.

places.address: Via Mike Bongiorno, 13, 20124 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Seta is a renowned Italian restaurant located in the Mandarin Oriental Milan, led by acclaimed chef Antonio Guida. The restaurant offers a contemporary twist on traditional Italian cuisine, with a focus on creative culinary techniques. Seta has garnered prestigious accolades such as Tre Forchette from Gambero Rosso and two Michelin stars. The elegant dining space features turquoise accents and provides guests with a view of the chefs at work in the theatre-style kitchen.

sources.snippet: At Seta, the kitchen becomes a stage for the chef‚Äôs creativity, producing dishes that are as visually stunning as they are palatably delightful. Each creation here is a thoughtful composition akin to a painter‚Äôs masterpiece.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants in Milan: Top Picks

places.name: Seta by Antonio Guida

reviews.text:
Dining at Seta, located within the Mandarin Oriental in Milan, is an unforgettable journey through contemporary Italian cuisine at its absolute finest. From the moment you enter, everything speaks of elegance, precision, and understated luxury.

Chef Antonio Guida's menu is a masterclass in creativity and technique - every dish beautifully plated, flavors perfectly balanced, and ingredients treated with the utmost respect. Each course is a harmonious blend of tradition and innovation, reflecting the very best of modern Italian gastronomy.

The service is flawless: attentive, knowledgeable, and discreet, creating an atmosphere where you can fully relax and enjoy the culinary artistry. The wine selection is equally impressive, curated to complement every nuance of the menu.

Seta is not just a dinner; it's a Michelin-starred experience that celebrates taste, texture, and presentation at the highest level. An absolute must for anyone who appreciates fine dining in Milan.

Having dinner at Seta is not just a meal, it is a food experience. Located inside the Mandarin Oriental, Seta delivers world-class service and unforgettable cuisine. The servers for our tasting menu were warm, attentive, and unobtrusive. Hospitality here has the same attention to detail as the food being served. Chef Antonio Guida and his team deliver a tasting menu nothing short of extraordinary. Each plate is as delicious to eat as it is beautiful to look at. It was seventeen courses, and we left full and happy but not overly stuffed. From pigeon to sea urchin to risotto to three courses of dessert featuring a special Easter bread, everything I ate was unique, delicious, and prepared in a creative way. Seta should be a destination for everyone. Chef Guida and his team have created a celebration of flavor and  hospitality that will leave a lasting impression with you. The meal was not inexpensive (it was rather expensive)  but it was definitely worth every penny. It is not hyperbole to say dinner was spectacular.

Amazing restaurant, fully in line of what you would expect from 2 stars. Elegant setting, polite service and amazing food. We took the standard menu and they were kind to allow us to swap some dishes and replace them with a la cart. My number one dish if I had to give rating was spaghetti with sea anemone and prawn tartar equally great was the signature risotto with strawberry and herbs. Then blu lobster but basically every dish was wonderful. Desert was a highlight too. Thank you Seta team for an unforgettable experience.

places.address: Via Monte di Piet√†, 18, 20121 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Enrico Bartolini is a renowned chef known for his exceptional culinary skills and innovative approach to haute cuisine. His restaurant, Ristorante Enrico Bartolini Mudec, located in the scenic location of Mudec-Museo delle Culture in Milan, has been awarded 3 Michelin stars in both 2020 and 2021. Bartolini's cuisine is described as contemporary classic, showcasing a blend of creativity and open-mindedness applied to haute cuisine.

sources.snippet: Enrico Bartolini‚Äôs restaurant at Mudec in Milan is spacious and airy, creating a relaxed setting for a modern dining experience. Led by executive chef Davide Boglioli, it focuses on carefully prepared dishes, with some final touches completed at the table. The atmosphere is welcoming and makes the meal feel special without being over the top.
sources.shortName: The 15 Best Romantic Restaurants in Milan

places.name: Enrico Bartolini

reviews.text:
An unforgettable experience from start to end. We visited Enrico Bartolini to celebrate a birthday, and it truly exceeded all expectations. From the moment we arrived, the staff's attention was warm, professional, and incredibly attentive.

We chose the "best off" Menu experience, and it was without a doubt and excellent decision. Each dish was a masterpiece, showcasing creativity, balance, and bold flavors.

The attention to detail throughout the evening was outstanding both in the food and in the overall service. The team made us feel special, and turned a simple celebration into a lifelong memory. Highly recommend for anyone seeking a truly world class dining.

We're so grateful for the unforgettable evening we had at Mudec. Every detail-from the exquisite food to the impeccable service-was flawless. It was a truly special way to conclude our anniversary trip.

Dining with them on the same day we experienced The Last Supper in Milan made the evening even more meaningful.

If you are given the opportunity to dine here, opt for the tasting menu with pairings.  It is totally worth it!  I have done a lot of Michelin dining, and this was the best service I have ever had.  They were personable, fun, and helpful, with flawless English.  The food of course was absolutely perfect -- They even accommodated one of our party who doesn't like seafood.

Thank you for an unforgettable evening!

We had family reunion lunch with 10 people at the restaurant Enrico Bartolini al MUDEC. I am grateful that the food and the service made the family reunion a memorable one. Our lunch was more than a meal-it was an emotional and sensory celebration.

We had the "MUDEC experience" menu. Each dish, from the citrus‚Äëbright seafood starters to the soul‚Äëwarming mains and playful desserts, left its own impression. Add to that the elegant yet welcoming service, and you have a recipe for memories that will last far beyond the table.

The menu was brilliantly curated, balanced, and beautifully presented-worthy of its three Michelin stars. A truly unforgettable feast that honors Italian tradition while pushing its boundaries.

Some of the dishes as I can remember:
Finta melanzana aubergine with scampi, the Po‚Äëriver oyster enveloped in a sphere of herbs, the "fake" Rocher with beef tartare and fois gras, the smoky fillet of lamb, and the rhubarb and strawberry dessert.

Although the waitstaff were young, their service was absolutely impeccable-attentive, prompt, respectful, and perfectly pitched for a joyful family reunion. Their warmth and professionalism elevated the entire experience, making it feel personal and effortless.

sources.snippet: Bu:r di Eugenio Boer is a small, elegant restaurant in Milan‚Äôs Ticinese district that highlights Italy‚Äôs favorite traditional dishes in a refined but welcoming setting. The team pays close attention to every detail, ensuring guests feel well taken care of. Its calm atmosphere makes it easy to enjoy a thoughtful dining experience without any rush or pretension.
sources.shortName: The 15 Best Romantic Restaurants in Milan

reviews.text:
A hidden gem!

What an amazing experience & meal.  From the second we walked into the restaurant, Carlotta made us feel like we were at home.  My friend and I came for a Sunday dinner,  we each did 'The Classic' which was delicious with every bite.  Our favorite dish was hands down, The Deer comprised of raspberry, mustard & crunchy chips.  Every bite had a new burst of flavor.

Cannot wait to come on my next trip to Milan!

Favorite restaurant of all time. I've been to 5 Michelin restaurants before this one, so I had a little experience before visiting.

To be honest there was not a single dish that left me dissatisfied. Actually I'm writing this review almost a year after going so I can't go into details about the dishes. However what I can tell you after 1 year, is that I haven't found another restaurant that impressed me this much, and I have two dishes from this restaurant stuck in my head.

One is the pasta con le vongole‚Ä¶ Who knew you can elevate such a simple Italian dish to such heights.

Second was the body temperature raw deer. Said like this it doesn't sounds great, but the whole point of this dish was to awaken the primitive instinct by eating raw delicate meat at around 36 Celsius. If I remember correctly the dish only comes with a black edible  looking net on top. A dish that I forever think about.

Incredible I can't wait to revisit!

From the moment you step in, you are enveloped in an atmosphere of refined elegance and impeccable hospitality. Every detail, from the sophisticated d√©cor, elegant tableware, to the warm, attentive service is excellent.  The menu is a testament to culinary artistry, with each dish showcasing a harmonious balance of flavors, textures, and presentation, telling a story with each course.  The wine selection is equally impressive and reasonably priced.  Dining here felt more like an experience than a meal.  Without a doubt, Chef and Carlotta, deserve every accolade and a place at the top of any food lover's list.

places.generalDescription: El Porteno Gourmet is a small Argentine restaurant which focuses on meat dishes and wine. The atmosphere is designed to evoke the 1940s Buenos Aires, with soft lighting and red velvet curtains. The menu features Argentinian staples like grilled beef, pork and veal, as well as specialties inspired by European cuisine. Malbec is one of the most popular wines in Argentina at the moment, so it's perfect to pair with the food.

sources.snippet: In Milan, in the small via Speronari a stone‚Äôs throw from the Duomo, El Porte√±o Gourmet is a small restaurant inspired by the fascinating atmosphere of the 1940s Buenos Aires. Between red velvet curtains, soft lighting and a soundtrack that echoes of bandone√≥n and elegant dancers, the venue is designed to offer the best of the legendary vida tanguera. The menu focuses on meat, especially grilled beef, pork and veal, as well as on the main specialties of Argentine cuisine to be paired with a glass of Malbec, one of the most popular red wines of South America.
sources.shortName: The most romantic restaurants in Milan

sources.snippet: Wine lovers would appreciate El Porte√±o Gourmet for its impressive selection of Malbec wines, which pairs beautifully with its Argentinian cuisine. In contrast, Monkey in the City offers more than a social hotspot; this bar is a hub for Milan‚Äôs chic and spirited crowds, with its modern twist on the traditional bar and vibrant flower arrangements. Whether we‚Äôre relaxing al fresco or nestled indoors, each venue in Milan‚Äôs bar and nightlife scene presents an authentic slice of the city‚Äôs sociable culture.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants in Milan: Top Picks

places.name: El Porte√±o Gourmet

reviews.text:
El Porte√±o was, without a doubt, the best dining experience during our 5-day stay in Milan. After indulging in plenty of risotto, pasta, and pizza, we were craving something different-and this place delivered beyond expectations.

Everything about El Porte√±o was outstanding: the atmosphere, the food, the service, and the overall ambiance. From the moment we walked in, we felt welcomed and knew we were in for a special evening.

It's honestly surprising that this gem isn't at the top of every list of restaurants in Milan. The attention to detail in every aspect made it a memorable experience. I'm so glad we chose El Porte√±o for our final dinner in Milan before heading to Florence-it was the perfect way to end our time in the city.

Highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a standout meal in Milan. Thank you, El Porte√±o, for a wonderful time!

For a steakhouse, the way the chef prepares the steaks is not up to par.

The three-way fillet that we had was cooked to the right doneness, but there're a lot of tendons in the meat, leading to a substantial portion of the steak being un-chewable.

As for the ribeye roll, we requested it to be medium rare, but when the steak arrived at our table, it looked like it's almost well done. The waiter also had difficulty cutting it for us, but we still each tried a piece regardless, thinking it might be the Milanese interpretation of the dish. However, to our disappointment, the steak was actually way too overcooked, and was impossible to chew.

We asked the waitress who placed our order if we had correctly made a request for medium rare, and she confirmed it and also agreed that the steak was not of the doneness that we ordered. She took action swiftly and asked the chef to prepare a new dish for us.

The second time the ribeye roll was served, it was only cooked to rare but we didn't really mind it. However, this time the steak had even more tendons than the fillet, which made it super difficult to cut, let alone chew.

That being sad, the steak sashimi with foie gras was perfect, and we could taste the freshness of the beef, with the foie gras and dressing taking the dish to a whole different level.

Apparently, the chef needs to practice precision cooking, but his ability to season the ingredients should be commended.

Appetisers, bread and selection of five side dishes together with three meat souses goes as a complement, very nice!
The food is of a very good quality and the service is very attentive. Cozy street and interior.
We had a lovely evening!

places.generalDescription: Parco Industria Alfa Romeo - Portello is a modern city park in Milano, designed by landscape architects Charles Jencks and Andreas Kipar. It covers 60,000 square meters and features sculptural landscaping that creates a diagonal continuity with Parco Monte Stella. The park serves as a gentle transition from the bustling Viale Alcide De Gasperi and Viale Renato Serra to the surrounding areas.

sources.snippet: At Portello Park, lovers walk along a spiral of sorts that takes them on top of a hill. From above, the couples look down observing the city at their love‚Äôs feet. So even north-west Milano has its romantic corner, right behind a dynamic, ever-growing area.
sources.shortName: Romantic Milano

places.name: Parco Industria Alfa Romeo - Portello

reviews.text: This was the first park that I went to after moving to Milan, a new city, a new country for a young girl. The morning was beautifully pleasant with the sun peeking through the ample greenery in the park. There are a lot of dog-owners around with their cute little pets playing around and adding to the vibe of the park. There are many areas with different viewpoints and features. My favourite feature is a spiral ascending walkway, at the top of which is a natural drinking water fountain and a glorious view out into City Life, a busy and posh district in northern Milan. There's a duck pond too with a large area for seating. Overall, this has been a place of comfort and happiness for me since arriving in the city. ‚ù§Ô∏è

It was a great and nature experience leaves are all green and different kind of leafs which different Color's too. It's quiet big. There were paths where you can hide and seek with your kiddo's or have an adventure on it. There were also a connection to arrive in city life. If you prefer to walked to passed by or to go into another place this is perfect. There were also a shopping place here it's all walking distance to one place to another. I recommend to visit and have some work specially with your family. A simple bonding with friends too.

A park rather in a French garden style. Very small, right next to the beltway, so the neighbourhood is not tempting. In the middle there is a tiny hill with a DNA-shaped statue. There's a free toilet near the park (in Piazza Portello).

places.address: Viale Renato Serra, 31, 20149 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Ristorante la Brisa is a small gastronomic gem located in the historic center of Milan, offering creative interpretations of Lombardy dishes in a stylish setting with a leafy garden. The restaurant overlooks the remains of an ancient Roman palace and provides a relaxed and intimate atmosphere for candlelight dinners surrounded by artworks. Guests have the option to dine in the refined interior or amidst centuries-old lime trees in the courtyard.

sources.snippet: With pretty lime trees on its terrace, La Brisa (in the street of the same name) is one of Milan‚Äôs most romantic restaurants. It is in the heart of the old city, and every aspect of the place exudes elegance and good taste. Here you can enjoy the Lombardy capital‚Äôs mouth-watering typical cuisine.
sources.shortName: Ideas for enjoying Milan as a couple

places.name: Ristorante la Brisa

reviews.text: We were lucky to get the last available table as a walk in. That meant we didn't get to see the patio or the main dining room, but the food and services made up for it. Inventive, tasty dishes (the poached egg and beans was a standout). Great wine pairing. Wonderful bread basket. Friendly, capable service, despite the slightly upmarket vibe. Recommended.

I made a point to try this restaurant because of its high reputation. I am a foreign visitor and I was quite nervous because of my poor Italian, but the staff and owners were very kind. (It is not that I expected otherwise, only I was very self-conscious.) The boar filet is unlike anything I've tried, and alone is worth the visit. Rare and flavorful medallions with a crisp crust that includes cocoa, incredibly delicious. Wine suggestions were appropriate as well.

A little gem.
You never expect such a lovely place when you arrive at the door.  The food is impeccable with a little twist on traditional dishes.  The service was friendly and the owner/manager is present with full interest on each and every guest. The garden is lovely and quiet.
It was a really nice surprise for us

places.generalDescription: Carefully chosen ingredients cooked in Roman style, in a modern eatery, famous for its artichokes.

sources.snippet: Cacio & Pepe Restaurant in Milan focuses on Roman-inspired cooking served in a laid-back, welcoming setting. It‚Äôs a relaxed spot for a midweek meal or a casual night out, with carefully chosen ingredients and a solid wine list. The straightforward cooking and friendly service make it a pleasant option for fans of regional Italian cuisine.
sources.shortName: The 15 Best Romantic Restaurants in Milan

sources.snippet: The celebrated Cacio & Pepe Restaurant offers an authentic taste with their array of pasta dishes, including the Roman classic after which they‚Äôre named.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants in Milan: Top Picks

places.name: Cacio & Pepe Restaurant

reviews.text:
Very elegant and nice restaurant. The atmosphere is sophisticated,  the waiters know their menu and wines, and the food and wine selections are excellent.
The restaurant is in a nice area, and you can have a stroll around before or after.

I had 2 appetizers (both with artichokes) and the signature dish cacio & pepe. All three were delicious.
Also a glass of the house white wine and a glass of the house red wine. Good wine too.
Service was friendly and quick.
The food was really good, especially the artichokes and the carbonara were amazing. Very friendly staff, beautiful environment and delicious food. Highly recommend to everyone!

places.address: V.le Gian Galeazzo, 3, 20136 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Bentoteca is a chic restaurant in Milan that offers a unique fusion of Japanese and Italian cuisines. Run by Chef Yoji Tokuyoshi, who previously worked at Osteria Francescana, the restaurant presents a modern dining experience with its creative dishes. The menu features a blend of Japanese bento box-inspired meals and Italian ingredients, resulting in innovative offerings like sake-marinated pigeon and Wagyu Don.

sources.snippet: Bentoteca is a relaxed Japanese bistro in Milan led by chef Yoji Tokuyoshi, who once worked at Osteria Francescana. It blends Japanese and Italian influences in an approachable way, using local ingredients whenever possible. The laid-back atmosphere makes it a welcoming spot to enjoy creative cooking without the fuss of formal fine dining.
sources.shortName: The 15 Best Romantic Restaurants in Milan

places.name: Bentoteca Milano

reviews.text:
One of the best places I've tried in Milan. The cuisine here is a mix of traditional Japanese cuisine and a modern cuisine by using great ingredients to create that umami taste.
We were three people and we had many different dishes from the menu to share so had the opportunity to try many plates.
Service was well organized and accurate, we had a great experience

Overrated and expensive for what it is. If you're a food connoisseur, this restaurant will likely disappoint. I'm genuinely confused by the 5-star reviews and its inclusion in the Michelin Guide.

We came for an √† la carte dinner and ordered several popular items as suggested; three starters, two mains, and four wines.

Unfortunately, the dishes were overly salty, and lacked freshness. The so-called ‚Äúseafood‚Äù udon was undercooked and had minimal, shriveled bits of seafood that I had to dig for - very misleading.

Portions were small, and while the service was friendly, it was also quite slow.

For the price, the experience feels unjustified - the quality simply doesn't match the hype or the cost. If I'm paying a premium price, I expect premium food.

It was a great dining experience here! We had the omakase menu and every dish was chef's kiss! The 2 rounds of starters were fabulous! We love every tuna dish and the chicken & eel skewer too!

Service was really remarkable, very personable and friendly!

Will definitely visit if I am ever in Milan again.

places.address: Via S. Calocero, 3, 20123 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Al Fresco is a charming restaurant located in an old factory, offering a unique dining experience in a garden setting. The outdoor space is adorned with various trees and plants, creating a picturesque atmosphere. The menu features a variety of modern Italian dishes, including classic starters and creatively revisited pasta and main courses.

sources.snippet: In via Savona in Milan, Al Fresco is a fairy tale greenhouse, set up every three months with ever new floral scenographies and thousands of candles and lights. The garden, a real wonder, is one of the most romantic in the city, full of centenary trees, such as mulberry, beautiful peach and cherry trees, many flowering species, including jasmine and rose gardens, and an enchanting terrace called ‚Äúof wisteria‚Äù as in spring it is enveloped by a spectacular lilac cloud. The cuisine looks to the Mediterranean tradition with typical Milanese touches and it is just perfect for a lunch or dinner based on raw fish and Franciacorta bubbles.
sources.shortName: The most romantic restaurants in Milan

places.name: Al Fresco

reviews.text: We visited for lunch in mid-January and had an absolutely wonderful experience. The food was incredible! I ordered the salmon with grilled vegetables on the side, and it was perfectly cooked and delicious. The service was equally outstanding. One member of our group is gluten intolerant, and the waiter went above and beyond to ensure she had great options to choose from. Overall, a fantastic dining experience, and we'll definitely be back!

Overall it was a positive experience. The venue is elegant, with a welcoming atmosphere that strikes a good balance between sophistication and comfort. Despite being full, the noise level was acceptable and did not interfere with conversation.

The food was of good quality, and each dish was presented with care. The courses were well-balanced, and the flavors met expectations. However, the desserts were the least impressive part of the meal: they didn't capture the same attention to detail and perfection as the main dishes.

The service, though polite, could be improved. One aspect I found a bit off-putting was the insistence on trying to sell additional dishes and drinks, which somewhat detracted from the experience.

As for the price, it's on the medium-high side: our bill for an appetizer, a main course, and a dessert (without wine) was 70 euros per person, which I consider fair for the quality of the dishes, but not exactly cheap.

Dining at Al Fresco was fabulous from start to end. Quality of food, service and atmosphere were outstanding. To finish off with a great experience, like many Michelin starred restaurants do, they gave us a little bag to eat for breakfast the next morning.

places.generalDescription: The restaurant La Balera dell'Ortica is an Italian classic that is known for its delicious food and charming atmosphere. The place is perfect for a night out with friends, and the music played by Mary and the Quant was fantastic. The service was in Italian, but all of it was very friendly and helpful.

sources.shortName: Things to do in Milan for couples

places.name: Ristorante La Balera dell'Ortica

reviews.text:
I am Belal.I Come from Bangladesh.

The environment here is very beautiful.  The taste of the food is very delicious.  And the performances have a different kind of beauty.You can also come. Food quality is ten out of ten
Always vibrant with live music. Sometimes jazz, sometimes vocal + strings. Good food, great place for friends and parties. Is open until late night
The food is delicious. The ambiance was for us a little crowded. We liked the service. And all Italians very nice people. We have to return next time, when we go to Milan

places.address: Via Giovanni Antonio Amadeo, 78, 20134 Milano MI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Atmosph√®re is a restaurant that rides through the city on vintage trams. It offers a variety of multi-course brunches and dinners, with an emphasis on unique and delicious food. The experience is definitely something different and worth checking out if you're ever in Milan!

sources.snippet: Dining on a charming old-fashioned ATMosfera Tram traveling across the city, surrounded by important points of interests, is the epitome of romance. You can book an expeience on Milan‚Äôs moving tram online.
sources.shortName: Romantic Spots for a Wedding Proposal in Milan
Things to do in Milan for couples

places.name: ATMosfera

reviews.text: We loved every moment of this tram ride! The tram was a gorgeous retrofitted carriage from 1920 with nice comfortable seats and an elegant atmosphere. The staff were kind and professional - how could the driver and the waiter time it so perfectly that we arrived at the end the moment we finished our coffee? Okay, this is not a super high end food experience but still very nice. Water and drinks were provided generously. My one suggestion is - please improve your online booking service. I worked VERY HARD to get a table for 2, for two weeks I kept checking and refreshing until your booking rules changed 3 days before departure and allowed smaller groups at tables of 4. As a result you departed with many empty tables and lost income. I am an airline revenue manager and can provide some ideas on how to improve your pricing and booking! But seriously - keep it up, we loved every minute.

It was a fantastic idea to dine on a tram that lets you see Milan, an old historic tram. The staff is kind and the journey lasts about two hours. The cost is 90 euros per person, which includes an appetizer, first course, main course, dessert, coffee, and a bottle of wine for two people.

The price is worth it for the idea and the charm of the experience, which is unique. The food was good but not exceptional. The white wine was warm and the pasta was overcooked, which was a shame. I would have preferred a typical Milanese menu and more professional service.

The process for rescheduling or canceling is very strict. However, it is worth trying this experience.

Good idea to  book in advance.
Loved every minute of the ATMosfera Tram ride, which was a birthday surprise. Beautifully restored tram, great service, good food and lovely views of Milano en route.
